info.title: COUNTER_SUSHI API
info.description:
This version of the COUNTER_SUSHI API applies to Release 5.1 of the COUNTER Code of Practice, which can be read online at https://cop5.projectcounter.org/.

This workspace provides a detailed description of the entire COUNTER_SUSHI API, including the JSON schema for COUNTER Reports and Standard Views of the COUNTER Reports. 

It is expected that reporting services will use only the parts relevant to them, or make local tailored copies relevant to their particular circumstances, for example by removing methods detailing reports they do not support.

If you have any queries, please contact the Project Director (tasha.mellins-cohen@counterusage.org).

get.description:
Returns the current status of the reporting service(s) supported by the SUSHI server.

This path MUST be public to allow report consumers to easily check whether a SUSHI server is live.

Returns the institutions associated with the customer ID in the request and their customer IDs and requestor IDs (if required for API calls and differing from the requestor ID in the request).

The associated institutions can be consortium members, or sites for multi-site customers. If the customer in the request is neither a consortium nor multi-site, the list only includes the details for the customer itself.

This path is a good choice for testing SUSHI credentials.

Returns the list of reports supported by the SUSHI server for the customer, including the first and last months for which usage data has been processed and is available. This information SHOULD be specific for the customer ID.

Returns the COUNTER Report PR - Platform Report.

PR is a customizable report summarizing activity across a report providerâ€™s platforms that allows the user to apply filters and select other configuration options.

Returns the PR_P1 Standard Views of the Platform Report - Platform Usage.

PR_P1 reports on platform-level usage summarized by Metric_Type.

Returns the COUNTER Report DR - Database Report.

DR is a customizable report detailing activity by database that allows the user to apply filters and select other configuration options.

get.summary: DR_D1 - Database Search and Item Usage
tags: DR_D1 - Database Search and Item Usage
get.description:
Returns the DR_D1 Standard View of the Database Report - Database Search and Item Usage.

DR_D1 reports on key Searches, Investigations and Requests metrics needed to evaluate a database.

Returns the DR_D2 Standard View of the Database Report - Database Access Denied.

DR_D2 reports on Access Denied activity for databases where users were denied access because simultaneous-use licenses were exceeded or their institution did not have a license for the database.

Returns the COUNTER Report TR - Title Report.

TR is a customizable report detailing activity at the title level (journal, book, etc.) that allows the user to apply filters and select other configuration options.

Returns the TR_B1 Standard View of the Title Report - Book Requests (Controlled).

TR_B1 reports on full-text activity for books (Data_Types Book and Reference_Work), excluding Open and Free_To_Read content, as Total_Item_Requests and Unique_Title_Requests. The Unique_Title_Requests provides comparable usage across book platforms. The Total_Item_Requests shows overall activity; however, numbers between sites will vary significantly based on how the content is delivered (e.g. delivered as a complete book or by chapter).

Returns the TR_B2 Standard View of the Title Report - Book Access Denied.

TR_B2 reports on Access Denied activity for books (Data_Types Book and Reference_Work) where users were denied access because simultaneous-use licenses were exceeded or their institution did not have a license for the book.

get.summary: TR_B3 - Book Usage by Access Type
tags: TR_B3 - Book Usage by Access Type
get.description:
Returns the TR_B3 Standard View of the Title Report - Book Usage by Access Type.

TR_B3 reports on book usage (Data_Types Book and Reference_Work) showing all applicable Metric_Types broken down by Access_Type.

Returns the TR_J1 Standard View of the Title Report - Journal Requests (Controlled).

TR_J1 reports on usage of journal content, excluding Open and Free_To_Read content, as Total_Item_Requests and Unique_Item_Requests. The Unique_Item_Requests provides comparable usage across journal platforms by reducing the inflationary effect that occurs when an HTML full text automatically displays and the user then accesses the PDF version. The Total_Item_Requests shows overall activity.

Returns the TR_J2 Standard View of the Title Report - Journal Access Denied.

TR_J2 reports on Access Denied activity for journal content where users were denied access because simultaneous-use licenses were exceeded or their institution did not have a license for the title.

get.summary: TR_J3 - Journal Usage by Access Type
tags: TR_J3 - Journal Usage by Access Type
get.description:
Returns the TR_J3 Standard View of the Title Report - Journal Usage by Access Type.

TR_J3 reports on usage of journal content for all Metric_Types broken down by Access_Type.

Returns the TR_J4 Standard View of the Title Report- Journal Requests by YOP (Controlled).

TR_J4 breaks down the usage of journal content, excluding Open and Free_To_Read content, by year of publication (YOP), providing counts for the Metric_Types Total_Item_Requests and Unique_Item_Requests. Provides the details necessary to analyze usage of content in backfiles or covered by perpetual access agreement. Note that COUNTER reports do not provide access model or perpetual access rights details.

Returns the COUNTER Report IR - Item Report.

IR is a granular, customizable report showing activity at the level of the item (article, chapter, media object, etc.) that allows the user to apply filters and select other configuration options.

Returns the IR_A1 Standard View of the Item Report - Journal Article Requests.

IR_A1 reports on journal article requests at the article level. This report is limited to content with a Data_Type of Article and Metric_Types of Total_Item_Requests and Unique_Item_Requests.

Returns the IR_M1 Standard View of the Item Report - Multimedia Item Requests.

IR_M1 reports on multimedia requests at the item level.

Service_Active.description: Indicator if the service is currently able to deliver reports.

Registry_Record.description: The link to the platformâ€™s COUNTER Registry record. Report providers who do not have a Registry record MUST omit this element.

Note.description: A general note about the service.

Alerts.description: Any alerts related to service interruptions and status.

Date_Time.description: Date-time of the alert, in RFC3339 date-time format.

examples.Description: COUNTER Usage Reports for EBSCOhost platform.

Alerts.Alert: Service will be unavailable Sunday midnight.

Status.description: Status of a reporting service supported by a SUSHI server.
Status.title: Status Information

Member.title: Member Information
Member.description: Customer ID and (if required for API requests) requestor ID for an institution.

Institution_ID.description: Other identifiers for the institution (besides the customer ID).

Customer_ID.description: Customer ID for requests to the API for this institution.

Requestor_ID.description: Requestor ID for requests to the API for the institution. This element MUST be omitted if the requestor ID is identical to the requestor ID in the request (or the SUSHI server does not use requestor IDs).

Report.title: Report Information
Report.description: Information about a report supported by a SUSHI server.

Report_Name.description: Name of the report. For COUNTER Reports and Stadard Views of COUNTER Reports this is the Report_Name in the Report_Header.

Report_ID.description: ID of the report used in the request (in lower case). For COUNTER Reports and Standard Views of COUNTER Reports this is the Report_ID in the Report_Header.

Path.description: Path to use when requesting this report. Optional but recommended for custom reports. For COUNTER Reports and Standard Views of COUNTER Reports the path MUST be identical with the path specified in the Code of Practice, if the element is not omitted.

First_Month_Available.description: First month for which usage data has been processed and is available.

Last_Month_Available.description: Last month for which usage data has been processed and is available.

DR_D1.title: DR_D1 - Database Search and Item Usage

TR_B3.title: TR_B3 - Book Usage by Access Type

TR_J3.title: TR_J3 - Journal Usage by Access Type
x-tags: TR_J3 - Journal Usage by Access Type

Report_ID.description: The unique identifier of the report.

Release.description: The COUNTER release this report complies with.

Institution_Name.description: The name of the organization to which the usage is attributed.

Institution_ID.description: A series of identifiers that represent the institution. The customer ID used for requesting the report MUST be included, usually with the platform ID as namespace. For reports to â€œThe Worldâ€, Institution_ID should be 0000000000000000, with the platform ID as namespace.

Report_Filters.description: A series of report filters applied on the reported usage, including Begin_Date and End_Date (see the Base_Report_Filters object).

Exceptions.description: An indication of some difference between the usage that was requested and the usage that is being presented in the report. See the Exception objects for details.

Created.description: The date and time the usage was prepared, in RFCRFC3339 date-time format.

Created_By.description: The name of the organization or system that created the COUNTER report.

Registry_Record.description: The link to the platformâ€™s COUNTER Registry record. Report providers who do not have a Registry record MUST leave the value blank.

Customer_ID.description: When a COUNTER Report contains usage for multiple organizations, this element can be used to break the usage down by institution. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Institution_Name.description: When a COUNTER Report contains usage for multiple organizations, this element can be used to break the usage down by institution. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Country_Name.description: Name of the country according to ISO 3166-1. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Country_Code.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Subdivision_Name.description: Name of the country subdivision according to ISO 3166-2. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Subdivision_Code.description: ISO 3166-2 code of the country subdivision. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Attributed.description: Whether the report provider was able to attribute the usage to an institution or not. This is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

Code.description: Exception Code. See Table D.1 in the Code of Practice, Appendix D.

Message.description: Exception Message. See Table D.1 in the Code of Practice, Appendix D.

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_0.title: Exception 0

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_0.description:
Info or Debug Message. These Messages will never be standardized and service providers can design them as they see fit.

Note: The standard Exceptions with Code > 999 MUST be used for the indicated invocation conditions, it is neither permitted to use custom Exceptions with Code <= 999 instead nor to define custom Exceptions with Code > 999.

Exception_1-999.title: Exception 1-999
Exception_1-999.description:
Warning Message. This range is reserved for the use of service providers to supply their own custom warnings.

Note: The standard Exceptions with Code > 999 MUST be used for the indicated invocation conditions, it is neither permitted to use custom Exceptions with Code <= 999 instead nor to define custom Exceptions with Code > 999.

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1000.title: Exception 1000

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1000.description: The service is executing a request, but due to internal errors cannot complete the request. If possible, the server should provide an explanation in the additional Data element.

Exception_1010.title: Exception 1010

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1010.description: The service is too busy to execute the incoming request. The client should retry the request after some reasonable time.

Exception_1011.title: Exception 1011

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1011.description: Services queueing incoming report requests must return a response with this Exception and no payload to inform the client about the processing status. The client should retry the request after some reasonable time.

Exception_1020.title: Exception 1020

Message.const: Client has made too many requests

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1020.description: If the service sets a limit on the number of requests a client can make within a given timeframe, the server will return this Exception when the client exceeds that limit. The server would provide an explanation of the limit in the additional Data element.

Exception_1030.title: Exception 1030

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_1030.description: There is insufficient data in the request to begin processing (e.g. missing requestor_id, no customer_id, etc.).

Exception_2000.title: Exception 2000

Message.const: Requestor Not Authorized to Access Service

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_2000.description: If requestor_id is not recognized or not authorized by the service.

Exception_2010.title: Exception 2010

Message.const: Requestor is Not Authorized to Access Usage for Institution

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_2010.description: If requestor_id has not been authorized to harvest usage for the institution identified by the customer_id, or if the customer_id is not recognized.

Exception_2011.title: Exception 2011

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_2011.description: Reporting to â€œThe Worldâ€, customer_id 0000000000000000, is not supported.

Exception_2020.title: Exception 2020

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_2020.description: The service requires a valid APIKey to access usage data and the key provided was not valid or not authorized for the data being requested.

Exception_3020.title: Exception 3020

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3020.description: Any format or logic errors involving date computations (e.g., end_date cannot be less than begin_date).

Exception_3030.title: Exception 3030

Message.const: No Usage Available for Requested Dates

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3030.description:
The service did not find any data for the specified date range and other filters (if any).

Note: If the usage for a requested month either hasnâ€™t been processed yet or is no longer available, only Exception 3031 or 3032 must be returned for that month.

Exception_3031.title: Exception 3031

Message.const: Usage Not Ready for Requested Dates

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3031.description:
The service has not yet processed the usage for one or more of the requested months, if some months are available that data should be returned. The Exception should include the months not processed in the additional Data element.

Note: If the requested begin_date is the current or a future month, the server should return Exception 3020. If the requested end_date is the current or a future month, the server may continue processing the request and include Exception 3031, the End_Date Report_Filter then should be set to the previous month (the last month that could have been processed).

Exception_3032.title: Exception 3032

Message.const: Usage No Longer Available for Requested Dates

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3032.description: The service does not have the usage for one or more of the requested months because the requested begin_date is earlier than the first month for which data has been processed and is available. If some months are available that data should be returned. The Exception should include the information about the months processed and available in the additional Data element.

Exception_3040.title: Exception 3040

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3040.description:
The request could not be fulfilled in its entirety, since some of the requested data is missing. The server should return the available data and provide an explanation in the additional Data element.

Note: This Exception is not intended for the conditions already covered by Exceptions 3030, 3031 and 3032. A use case for this Exception for example would be that usage data is missing because the logging has failed. Usually this Exception indicates a permanent error.

Exception_3050.title: Exception 3050

Message.const: Parameter Not Recognized in this Context

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3050.description:
The request contained one or more parameters that are not recognized by the server in the context of the report being serviced. The server should list the names of unsupported parameters in the additional Data element.

Note: The server is expected to ignore unsupported parameters and continue to process the request, returning data that is available without the parameter being applied.

Note: This Exception is only applicable for report requests. For report list, member list and server status requests parameters not recognized by the server should be ignored.

Exception_3060.title: Exception 3060

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3060.description:
The request contained one or more filter values that are not supported by the server. The server should list the names of unsupported filter values in the additional Data element.

Note: The server is expected to ignore unsupported filters and continue to process the request, returning data that is available without the filter being applied.

Note: If the begin_date or end_date value is invalid, the server must return Exception 3020. If the service requires a platform parameter, and the platform value is invalid, the server should return Exception 1030.

Exception_3061.title: Exception 3061

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3061.description:
A filter element includes multiple values in a pipe-delimited list; however, the supplied values are not all of the same scope (e.g., item_id filter includes article level DOIs and journal level DOIs or ISSNs).

Note: The server is expected to ignore the invalid filters and continue to process the request, returning data that is available without the filter being applied.

Exception_3062.title: Exception 3062

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3062.description:
The request contained one or more report attribute values that are not supported by the server. The server should list the names of unsupported report attribute values in the additional Data element.

Note: The server is expected to ignore unsupported report attributes and continue to process the request, returning data that is available without the report attribute being applied.

Exception_3063.title: Exception 3063

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3063.description:
The request contained include_component_details=True, but reporting on component usage is not supported.

Note: The server is expected to ignore unsupported report attributes and continue to process the request, returning data that is available without the report attribute being applied.

Exception_3070.title: Exception 3070

Help_URL.description: URL to a help page that explains the Exception in more detail.

Data.description: Additional data provided by the server to clarify the Exception.

Exception_3070.description:
A required filter was not included in the request. Which filters are required will depend on the report and the service being called. The server should list the names of the missing filters in the additional Data element.

Note: If begin_date or end_date is missing, the server must return Exception 1030. If the service requires a platform parameter, and platform is missing, the server also should return Exception 1030.

Note: Currently there are no other required report filters, so this Exception should not occur.

503_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 503

202_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 202

429_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 429

400_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 400

401_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 401

403_Exception.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 403

400_Exception_1030.description: Exception response for HTTP status code 400

customer_id.name: customer_id
customer_id.description: Identifies the customer to provide report data for.

platform.name: platform
platform.description: Name of the platform the report data is being requested for. Might be required if a SUSHI server provides usage data for multiple platforms.

requestor_id.name: requestor_id
requestor_id.description: Identifier which may be assigned by a report provider to the requester (e.g. institution or consortium) that is asking for usage data.

api_key.name: api_key
api_key.description: Unique code which may be assigned by a report provider to grant access to this API.

begin_date.name: begin_date
begin_date.description: Reporting period start date in the form of yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm.

end_date.name: end_date
end_date.description: Reporting period end date in the form of yyyy-mm-dd or yyyy-mm.

metric_type.name: metric_type
metric_type.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Metric_Types separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Omit this parameter to include all Metric_Types.

data_type.name: data_type
data_type.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Data_Types separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Omit this parameter to include all Data_Types.

access_method.name: access_method
access_method.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Access_Methods separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Omit this parameter to include all Access_Methods.

attributes_to_show.name: attributes_to_show
attributes_to_show.description: Optional Report_Attribute. A list of attributes separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to include as separate elements in the report. When an element is included, the usage will be presented for each value of that element, otherwise the usage will be rolled up for all values.

granularity.name: granularity
granularity.description: Optional Report_Attribute. Include this parameter to retrieve usage with a granularity of Month (default if omitted) or Total (usage not broken down by months).

database.name: database
database.description: Name of a specific database usage is being requested for. If omitted, all databases on the platform with usage for the customer will be returned.

access_type.name: access_type
access_type.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Access_Types separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Omit this parameter to include all Access_Types.

yop.name: yop
yop.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of ranges of years of publication in the format of yyyy or yyyy-yyyy separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Omit this parameter to include all years of publication.

item_id.name: item_id
item_id.description: Identifier of a specific title usage is being requested for. If omitted, all titles on the platform with usage for the customer will be returned.

author.name: author
author.description: Identifier of a specific author usage is being requested for. If omitted, all items on the platform with usage for the customer will be returned.

include_component_details.name: include_component_details
include_component_details.description: Optional Report_Attribute. Include this parameter to include details of the item components in the report (if supported by the SUSHI server). Omitting the parameter will exclude the item component elements.

include_parent_details.name: include_parent_details
include_parent_details.description: Optional Report_Attribute. Include this parameter to include details of the item parents in the report, e.g. information about the journal in which an article is published. Omitting the parameter will exclude the item parent elements.

attributed.name: attributed
attributed.description: Optional Report_Filter. Include this parameter to retrieve usage (not) attributed to institutions. Attributed is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

country_code.name: country_code
country_code.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Country_Codes separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Country_Code is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).

subdivision_code.name: subdivision_code
subdivision_code.description: Optional Report_Filter. A list of Subdivision_Codes separated by the | character (URL encoded as %7C) to return usage for. Subdivision_Code is a common extension, support is optional (see Section 11 of the Code of Practice for details).
